meanings.definition: The area along the edge of a body of water.
meanings.sent1: Families enjoyed picnics by the watersides.
meanings.sent2: The ducks swam peacefully along the watersides of the pond.
meanings.sent3: The children played tag near the watersides, trying not to fall in.
meanings.sent4: The sun set behind the watersides, painting the sky in hues of orange and pink.
meanings.sent5: The sound of waves crashing against the watersides was soothing.

meanings.definition: A side or part of a ship that is in contact with water.
meanings.sent1: The crew members scrubbed the watersides of the ship to keep it clean.
meanings.sent2: The barnacles clinging to the watersides of the boat needed to be removed.
meanings.sent3: The sailors joked about painting a smiley face on the watersides of the vessel.
meanings.sent4: The ship creaked as it glided through the watersides of the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The salty spray from the watersides misted the sailors on deck.

meanings.definition: A place or location near water.
meanings.sent1: The cozy cabin was nestled among the watersides of the lake.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant had a beautiful view of the watersides of the river.
meanings.sent3: The campers roasted marshmallows by the watersides, telling ghost stories.
meanings.sent4: The path meandered through the watersides, offering a serene walk.
meanings.sent5: The quaint town was charming with its houses along the watersides.
